column4: anyone know a good command to figure out what motherboard you have in ubuntu?
a screwdriver it the best way - you can identify lots if you know the make and model of the machine in some cases
ah, gotta do it the old fashion way then I guess >.< I had hoped I wouldnt have to take the lappy apart,
what info are you looking for chipsets are available in /proc and lshw
I know what pci and usb devices I got, I need to know my motherboard model so I can figure out if coreboot v2 would work on my lappy
